description:
This is a library module offering the same set of functions
 defined by Microsoft Excel, under Text and Data Functions.

functions.name: asc
functions.signature: ($text as xs:string) as xs:string
functions.description: Returns the given $text unchanged.
functions.summary: Returns the given $text unchanged.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: the time

returns.description: The given $text unchanged.

functions.name: char
functions.signature: ($number as xs:integer) as xs:string
functions.description: Returns the character specified by a certain codepoint.
functions.summary: Returns the character specified by a certain codepoint.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: the codepoint.

returns.description: the character specified by a certain codepoint.

functions.name: clean
functions.signature: ($arg as xs:string?) as xs:string?
functions.description: Removes all nonprintable characters from text.
functions.summary: Removes all nonprintable characters from text.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the string.

returns.description:
Removes all nonprintable characters from text. The CLEAN function was designed. to remove the first 32 nonprinting characters in the 7-bit ASCII code (values 0 through 31) from text.

In the Unicode character set, there are additional nonprinting characters (values 127, 129, 141, 143, 144, and 157).

By itself, the CLEAN function does not remove these additional nonprinting characters.

functions.name: code
functions.signature: ($arg as xs:string) as xs:integer
functions.description: Returns a codepoint for the first character in a text string.
functions.summary: Returns a codepoint for the first character in a text string.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the string.

returns.description: A codepoint for the first character in a text string.

functions.name: concatenate
functions.signature: ($args as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:string
functions.description: Joins several text strings into one text string.
functions.summary: Joins several text strings into one text string.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: a sequence of strings.

returns.description: Joins several text strings into one text string.

functions.name: concatenate
functions.signature: ($arg1 as xs:anyAtomicType?, $arg2 as xs:anyAtomicType?) as xs:string
functions.description: Joins two text strings into one text string.
functions.summary: Joins two text strings into one text string.

parameters.name: arg1
parameters.description: the first string.

parameters.name: arg2
parameters.description: the second string.

returns.description: Joins two text strings into one text string.

functions.name: dollar
functions.signature: ($number as xs:decimal) as xs:string
functions.description:
Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol. The number of
digits to the right of the decimal point is 2.
functions.summary: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: is the number.

returns.description: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol. The number of digits to the right of the decimal point is 2.

functions.name: dollar
functions.signature: ($number as xs:decimal, $decimals as xs:decimal) as xs:string
functions.description: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol.
functions.summary: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: is the number.

parameters.name: decimals
parameters.description:
is the number of digits to the right of the decimal point.

If decimals is negative, number is rounded to the left of the decimal point.

returns.description: Converts a number to text format and applies a currency symbol.

functions.name: exact
functions.signature: ($arg1 as xs:string, $arg2 as xs:string) as xs:boolean
functions.description:
Compares two text strings and returns TRUE if they are exactly the same,
FALSE otherwise. EXACT is case-sensitive but ignores formatting differences.
functions.summary: Compares two text strings and returns TRUE if they are exactly the same, FALSE otherwise.

parameters.name: arg1
parameters.description: the first string.

parameters.name: arg2
parameters.description: the second string.

returns.description: Compares two text strings and returns TRUE if they are exactly the same, FALSE otherwise. EXACT is case-sensitive but ignores formatting differences.

functions.name: find
functions.signature: ($find_text as xs:string, $within_text as xs:string) as xs:integer?
functions.description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

The search is case sensitive.
functions.summary: Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

parameters.name: find_text
parameters.description: text you want to find.

parameters.name: within_text
parameters.description: text in which you want to search for $find_text.

returns.description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

The search is case sensitive.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value the value is not greater than zero or is greater than the length of within_text.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: find
functions.signature: ($find_text as xs:string, $within_text as xs:string, $start_num as xs:integer) as xs:integer?
functions.description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

The search is case sensitive.
functions.summary: Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

parameters.name: find_text
parameters.description: text you want to find.

parameters.name: within_text
parameters.description: text in which you want to search for $find_text.

parameters.name: start_num
parameters.description: specifies the character at which to start the search.

returns.description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

The search is case sensitive.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value the value is not greater than zero or is greater than the length of within_text.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: fixed
functions.signature: ($number as xs:decimal, $decimals as xs:decimal) as xs:string
functions.description:
Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in
 decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.
functions.summary: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: is the number you want to round and convert to text.

parameters.name: decimals
parameters.description: is the number of digits to the right of the decimal point.

returns.description: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.

functions.name: fixed
functions.signature: ($number as xs:decimal, $decimals as xs:decimal, $no_commas as xs:boolean) as xs:string
functions.description:
Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in
decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.
functions.summary: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: is the number you want to round and convert to text.

parameters.name: decimals
parameters.description: is the number of digits to the right of the decimal point.

parameters.name: no_commas
parameters.description: is a logical value that, if TRUE, prevents FIXED from including commas in the returned text.

returns.description: Rounds a number to the specified number of decimals, formats the number in decimal format using a period and commas, and returns the result as text.

functions.name: left
functions.signature: ($arg as xs:string) as xs:string
functions.description: Returns the first character in a text string.
functions.summary: Returns the first character in a text string.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: is the text string that contains the characters you want to extract.

returns.description: The first character in a text string.

functions.name: left
functions.signature: ($text as xs:string, $num_chars as xs:integer) as xs:string
functions.description: Returns the first character or characters in $text, based on the number of $num_chars you specify.
functions.summary: Returns the first character or characters in $text, based on the number of $num_chars you specify.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: is the text string that contains the characters you want to extract.

parameters.name: num_chars
parameters.description: specifies the number of characters you want to extract.

returns.description: The first character or characters in $text, based on the number of $num_chars you specify.

functions.name: len
functions.signature: ($arg as xs:string?) as xs:integer
functions.description: Returns the number of characters in a text string.
functions.summary: Returns the number of characters in a text string.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the string.

returns.description: The number of characters in a text string.

functions.name: lower
functions.signature: ($arg as xs:string?) as xs:string?
functions.description: Converts all uppercase letters in a text string to lowercase.
functions.summary: Converts all uppercase letters in a text string to lowercase.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the string.

returns.description: Converts all uppercase letters in a text string to lowercase.

functions.name: mid
functions.signature: ($text as xs:string?, $start_num as xs:integer, $num_chars as xs:integer) as xs:string?
functions.description:
Returns a specific number of characters from a text string, starting at
the position you specify, based on the number of characters you specify.
functions.summary: Returns a specific number of characters from a text string, starting at the position you specify, based on the number of characters you specify.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: the text string containing the characters you want to extract.

parameters.name: start_num
parameters.description: the position of the first character you want to extract in text. The first character in text has start_num 1, and so on.

parameters.name: num_chars
parameters.description: the number of characters you want to return from text.

returns.description: A specific number of characters from a text string, starting at the position you specify, based on the number of characters you specify.

functions.name: pad-integer-to-length
functions.signature: ($toPad as xs:anyAtomicType?, $padChar as xs:string, $length as xs:integer) as xs:string
functions.description: Returns $toPad appended with enough repetitions of $padChar to make its length $length, the characters are added before the string.
functions.summary: Returns $toPad appended with enough repetitions of $padChar to make its length $length, the characters are added before the string.

parameters.name: toPad
parameters.description: the value to be padded.

parameters.name: padChar
parameters.description: the character used for padding.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: the desired length.

returns.description: $toPad appended with enough repetitions of $padChar to make its length $length, the characters are added before the string.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the length of the $toPad is greater than the desired length.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: replace
functions.signature: ($old_text as xs:string?, $start_num as xs:integer, $num_chars as xs:integer, $new_text as xs:string) as xs:string
functions.description: Replaces part of a text string, based on the number of characters you specify, with a different text string.
functions.summary: Replaces part of a text string, based on the number of characters you specify, with a different text string.

parameters.name: old_text
parameters.description: is text in which you want to replace some characters.

parameters.name: start_num
parameters.description: the position of the character in old_text that you want to replace with new_text.

parameters.name: num_chars
parameters.description: the number of characters in old_text that you want REPLACE to replace with new_text.

parameters.name: new_text
parameters.description: the text that will replace characters in old_text.

returns.description: Replaces part of a text string, based on the number of characters you specify, with a different text string.

functions.name: right
functions.signature: ($arg as xs:string) as xs:string
functions.description: Returns the last character in a text string.
functions.summary: Returns the last character in a text string.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the text string containing the characters you want to extract.

returns.description: The last character in a text string.

functions.name: right
functions.signature: ($text as xs:string, $num_chars as xs:integer) as xs:string
functions.description: Returns the last character or characters in a text string, based on the number of characters you specify.
functions.summary: Returns the last character or characters in a text string, based on the number of characters you specify.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: the text string containing the characters you want to extract.

parameters.name: num_chars
parameters.description: specifies the number of characters you want RIGHT to extract.

returns.description: The last character or characters in a text string, based on the number of characters you specify.

functions.name: search
functions.signature: ($find_text as xs:string, $within_text as xs:string) as xs:integer?
functions.description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

The search starts at position 1, and it is not case sensitive.
functions.summary: Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

parameters.name: find_text
parameters.description: text you want to find.

parameters.name: within_text
parameters.description: text in which you want to search for $find_text.

returns.description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

The search starts at position 1, and it is not case sensitive.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value the value is not greater than zero or is greater than the length of within_text.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: search
functions.signature: ($find_text as xs:string, $within_text as xs:string, $start_num as xs:integer) as xs:integer?
functions.description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

The search starts at $start_num, and it is not case sensitive.
functions.summary: Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

parameters.name: find_text
parameters.description: text you want to find.

parameters.name: within_text
parameters.description: text in which you want to search for $find_text.

parameters.name: start_num
parameters.description: the character number in within_text at which you want to start searching.

returns.description:
Locate one text string within a second text string, and return the number of the starting position of the first text string from the first character of the second text string.

The search starts at $start_num, and it is not case sensitive.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value the value is not greater than zero or is greater than the length of within_text.</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: substitute
functions.signature: ($text as xs:string, $old_text as xs:string, $new_text as xs:string) as xs:string?
functions.description: Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string. Every occurrence of old_text in text is changed to new_text.
functions.summary: Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: the text or the reference to a cell containing text for which you want to substitute characters.

parameters.name: old_text
parameters.description: text you want to replace.

parameters.name: new_text
parameters.description: text you want to replace old_text with.

returns.description: Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string. Every occurrence of old_text in text is changed to new_text.

functions.name: substitute
functions.signature: ($text as xs:string, $old_text as xs:string, $new_text as xs:string, $instance_num as xs:integer?) as xs:string
functions.description: Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string.
functions.summary: Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: the text or the reference to a cell containing text for which you want to substitute characters.

parameters.name: old_text
parameters.description: text you want to replace.

parameters.name: new_text
parameters.description: text you want to replace old_text with.

parameters.name: instance_num
parameters.description:
specifies which occurrence of old_text you want to replace with new_text.

Only that instance of old_text is replaced.

returns.description:
Substitutes new_text for old_text in a text string.

Use SUBSTITUTE when you want to replace specific text in a text string; use REPLACE when you want to replace any text that occurs in a specific location in a text string.

functions.name: t
functions.signature: ($value as xs:anyAtomicType?) as xs:string
functions.description: Converts the $value to string.
functions.summary: Converts the $value to string.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the value

returns.description: Converts the $value to string.

functions.name: trim
functions.signature: ($text as xs:string?) as xs:string?
functions.description: Removes all spaces from text except for single spaces between words.
functions.summary: Removes all spaces from text except for single spaces between words.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: from which you want spaces removed.

returns.description: Removes all spaces from text except for single spaces between words.

functions.name: upper
functions.signature: ($text as xs:string?) as xs:string?
functions.description: Converts text to uppercase.
functions.summary: Converts text to uppercase.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: text you want converted to uppercase.

returns.description: Converts text to uppercase.

functions.name: value-except
functions.signature: ($arg1 as xs:anyAtomicType*, $arg2 as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType*
functions.description: Returns the values in one sequence that do not appear in the second sequence in an implementation-defined order.
functions.summary: Returns the values in one sequence that do not appear in the second sequence in an implementation-defined order.

parameters.name: arg1
parameters.description: the first sequence.

parameters.name: arg2
parameters.description: the second sequence.

returns.description: The values in one sequence that do not appear in the second sequence in an implementation-defined order.

functions.name: value
functions.signature: ($arg as xs:anyAtomicType?) as xs:anyAtomicType?
functions.description: Converts a text string that represents a number to a number.
functions.summary: Converts a text string that represents a number to a number.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.description: the value.

returns.description: Converts a text string that represents a number to a number.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value provided value is not a number.</xqdoc:error>
